basics.name: Nicholas Carr
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2023. I take pride in my communication skills and eagerness to learn.

courses: Cirriculum Development, Public Speaking, Training and Technology
Reactor Electronics, Nuclear Physics, Thermal Dynamics, Chemistry
DC Electrical Theory, AC Electrical Theory, Digital Electronics, EFEM

work.summary: Laboratory Assistant for Intro to Programming, Object Oriented Programming and Discrete Math
highlights: Help students to understand concepts and build foundations in computer science.
Develop new ways to deliver complex material to freshman and sophomore students.

work.position: Resident Manager at the Namahana Terrace
highlights: Communication and resolution of building issues.
Answer phone and email responses to Namahana Terrace maintenance queries.

work.summary: Qualified Senior in rate and 3M/QA supervisor
highlights: Maintenance and Battery manager for EE01
Developed Pearl Harbors first fully automated training system
Training Specialist, Ships Tag-out officer, Pre-approved tag out program

volunteer.summary: Lead developer for weather sensing project
highlights: Design firmware for distributed weather sensor network
Maintain custom data collection and storage infrastructure
Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.
